title: All Drug Seizures Involving Gulf Cartel in Nuevo Leon
name: All Drug Seizures Involving Gulf Cartel in Nuevo Leon
description: This data shows all of the drug seizures involving the Gulf Cartel in Nuevo Leon, Mexico from 09/15/2011 to 12/14/2011.

properties.details: Two packages of marijuana were recovered.
properties.security operations specs: Military personnel returned fire after they were attacked by the militants.
properties.bid: 12/02/2011: On Friday evening at 1800, in General Bravo, Nuevo Leon, Mexico, military personnel were attacked by alleged Golfo Cartel members and returned fire. The military pursued the gunmen for two kilometers. In the attack, one soldier died and two were injured. Military personnel seized 9 rifles, four handgung (one of which had engraved "Metro 33 Comandante" and a shield with a Nuevo Leon map and the letters CDG), one grenade launcher, seven 40mm grenades, two fragmentation grenades, 117 magazines for various weapons, 3000 different caliber cartridges, two packages of marijuana, 114 doses of marijuana (2 grams per dose), one bulletproof vest, ten ammunition belts, a reported stolen Mustang, and a reported stolen Tacoma.
properties.opinfo: Military personnel were involved in the operation.

properties.details: One bag of cocaine was recovered.
properties.bid: 12/02/2011: On Friday, in Colonia Mexico, Monterrey, Nuevo Leon, Mexico, four suspects of the attacks on the Bar Sabino Gordo and Cafe Iguana and also for hanging a man from a bridge were detained by Mexican authorities. They confessed to being members of the Golf Cartel. They were detained in a home in Colonia Mexico. They were identified as 38-year-old Francisco Gerardo Contreras Salas "El Paco," 40-year-old Sergio Valdez Garza "El Grenas," 45-year-old Vuitahuac Mendoza Garza "El Cuitla," and 35-year-old Daniel Issac Munoz Ramirez "El Bebe." Authorities seized two rifles, eight magazines, one grenade, three kilograms of marijuana, one bag of cocaine, and five vehicles from the assailants.
properties.opinfo: Mexican authorities were involved in the operation.
